wikipedia_page.main:
Job Mathew Raikes (1767–1833) was a British merchant and banker.
Raikes married Charlotte Bayly, daughter of Nathaniel Bayly, MP, and colonial plantation owner in Jamaica. Charles Raikes (1812–1885), East India Company servant and writer on India, was their son.

response: * Job Mathew Raikes (1767–1833) Governor of the Bank of England from 1801 to 1802
*Justin Mathew Raikes (b. 1970), financier and film producer, named after Job Mathew Raikes

The Curries belonged to an old Scottish family descended directly from the Curries of Duns, Berwickshire.Burke's Peerage and Baronetage, section CurrieThe Scottish Nation Currie His mother, Mary Anne Raikes, was the daughter of William Raikes and granddaughter of Robert Raikes, printer and newspaper proprietor. Her uncles included Thomas Raikes, Governor of the Bank of England from 1797 to 1799 and personal friend of William Wilberforce, the leader of the campaign against the slave trade; and Robert Raikes, the founder of Sunday schools.
